Upload File to Mistral AI API for OCR Processing

mistral_ocr_upload_file.Rd

This function uploads a local file to the Mistral AI API for OCR processing. It sends the file as a multipart form upload with an authorization header. You can enable verbose mode to get detailed HTTP request and response info for debugging.

Usage

mistral_ocr_upload_file(
  file_path,
  purpose = "ocr",
  api_key = Sys.getenv("MISTRAL_API_KEY"),
  endpoint = "https://api.mistral.ai/v1/files",
  verbose = FALSE,
  timeout = 60
)

Arguments

file_path

Character string. Path to the local file to upload.

purpose

Character string. The purpose for which the file is being uploaded. Default is "ocr".

api_key

Character string. The Mistral AI API key. Default is to retrieve from environment variable "MISTRAL_API_KEY".

endpoint

Character string. The Mistral AI API endpoint URL. Default is "https://api.mistral.ai/v1/files".

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, enables verbose HTTP request/response logging for debugging. Default is FALSE.

timeout

Numeric. Timeout in seconds for the upload request. Default is 60.

Value

List. Parsed JSON response from the Mistral AI API containing file metadata including file ID.

Author

Nathan C. Layman

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Upload a local PDF file
result <- mistral_ocr_upload_file("path/to/document.pdf")

# Use the returned file ID for OCR processing
file_id <- result$id

# Enable verbose mode to debug upload issues
result <- mistral_ocr_upload_file("path/to/document.pdf", verbose = TRUE)

# Specify a custom endpoint
result <- mistral_ocr_upload_file("path/to/document.pdf", 
                                 endpoint = "https://api.custom-mistral.ai/v1/files")
} # }
